raw:
```json
{
  "file": "Login.aspx",
  "vulnerabilities": [
    {
      "title": "Insecure Password Storage",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-256",
      "description": "The code does not specify how passwords are stored or validated. If passwords are stored in plaintext or using weak hashing algorithms, this poses a significant security risk.",
      "line_numbers": [1, 20],
      "recommendation": "Ensure that passwords are hashed using a strong algorithm (e.g., bcrypt, Argon2) before storage. Implement proper password management practices."
    },
    {
      "title": "Potential for Brute Force Attacks",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-307",
      "description": "The login form does not implement any account lockout mechanism or CAPTCHA to prevent brute force attacks.",
      "line_numbers": [20, 30],
      "recommendation": "Implement account lockout mechanisms after a certain number of failed login attempts and consider adding CAPTCHA to the login form."
    },
    {
      "title": "Lack of HTTPS Enforcement",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-319",
      "description": "The code does not enforce the use of HTTPS, which is necessary to protect sensitive information such as passwords during transmission.",
      "line_numbers": [1],
      "recommendation": "Ensure that the application is served over HTTPS and consider implementing HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS)."
    },
    {
      "title": "Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Risk",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-79",
      "description": "The use of <asp:Literal> for displaying failure messages could lead to XSS if the failure message is not properly sanitized.",
      "line_numbers": [30],
      "recommendation": "Ensure that any user input or error messages displayed in the application are properly encoded to prevent XSS attacks."
    }
  ]
}
```
